intro: Crepis pleurocarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Crepis pleurocarpa is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
